summary: This is a Daily Activity Report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for July 20, 2019. It details routine prison operations, staffing shortages, and inmate counts. The report is significant as it was created just weeks before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility, providing a snapshot of its operational status at the time.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine prison operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments in units 11 South, SHU #3, and 10 South #2.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report is dated July 21, 2019, documenting activities for July 20, 2019, placing it approximately three weeks before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility on August 10, 2019.
The report notes staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments in specific units, including the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
One inmate, referred to as 'TIM', was reported to be at a 'Local Hospice' under guard by the U.S. Marshals Service (USMS).
The total inmate population at the beginning of the morning watch shift on July 20, 2019, was 780.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case file evidence.
